授業目的: Research Seminar will allow students to conduct research and analyses on themes of their own choices.
到達目標:
Through group and individual guidance and consultation with the faculty, the students will carry out research/analyses on their research theme. The first part of the Research Seminar (Spring) consists of students' presentations on their theme and discussions. Students are expected to submit a thesis draft before summer (in June) and continue working on their theses the following year. Students must submit their thesis to the instructor by the end of November. The official thesis submission must be done by December 23, 2024. Late submissions will be severely penalized.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and  curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed. 
Research Seminars: 
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences. 
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods. 
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures. 
4. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.
